page.title: 04Little Shelford
page.content: {Old Times:}In the old days the village of Little Shelford was a pleasant country home.No television meant the entertainment was very limited,so the main sorts of entertainments were the radio,cards,newspapers and cinemas. There were very few houses mostly bungalows.The roads were practically the same as today.There used to be many pubs but now the only one I know of is the Peacock;the Greyhound and the Black Swan were knocked down.The only means of transport were walking or cycling.The shopkeepers were much more friendly with their customers. They only played cricket and football in the village and no rugby or hockey. {Today:}Little Shelford over a number of years has changed considerably.The houses are big and expensive.The towns are busy and on a summers day you hardly ever see a pavement without a
